basics.name: Nicholas Fung
basics.label: ML Engineer and Data Scientist
basics.summary: ML Engineer and Data Scientist with a MASc from UofT and a BASc from UBC.

work.name: Riskfuel Analytics
work.summary: Riskfuel uses deep learning to replicate complex derivative pricers written by quants at banks, with the goal of providing accurate approximations at a fraction of the cost for the purpose of real-time trading and P&L calculations. I was responsible for developing end-to-end ML pipelines, including synthetic data generation, training, validation, and delivering models to clients.

work.name: Non-Invasive Surgical Innovations
work.summary: NISI develops non-invasive surgical robotics. During my internship, I was responsible for implementing real-time video denoising, as well as researching Computer Vision techniques. I developed a prototype using the YOLO v3 algorithm to detect cancerous tumors.

volunteer.summary: nwPlus organizes several collegiate hackathons, including nwHacks, one of the largest hackathons in the Pacific Northwest, with over 600+ attendees. I was the Logistics Coordinator and later the Treasurer for the university club.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Variational Autoencoders: A Hands-Off Approach to Volatility
publications.publisher: The Journal of Financial Data Science

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
